properties.title: Kenyon Industries
properties.description: This is where the fabric for the sails is created.

properties.title: North Cloth stage #2
properties.description: This is the second time that the process goes through Milford. The second time around the sails are complete and ready to ship.

properties.title: North Sails Factory
properties.description: This is where the sails are cut and finished. They then get shipped back to Milford Connecticut

properties.title: North Cloth stage #1
properties.description: This is the first time the fabric goes through Milford. It eventually gets sent out to Sri Lanka.

properties.title: Patriot's Point Sailing Center
properties.description: The final destination for the sails where they are taken out of the freight and put on the boats.

properties.title: North Cloth to North Sails Factory
North Sails Factory to North Cloth
North Sails Factory to North Sails One-Design San Diego
properties.description: This is where the sails were to be sent if they had travelled by sea. CofC chose Milford by air because it is faster.

properties.title: North Cloth stage #2 to Patriot's Point Sailing Center

properties.description: This is a mapped out version of the process and shipping the new sails on the 420's at the College of Charleston
properties.title: Commodity Chain for the Sails of the Boats at the College of Charleston
